metadata.synopsis: Confrontation with Florrick if Ravengard died.
metadata.how_to_trigger: - Kill Ravengard;- Go to 33; 35; -41;OR- Use origin debug book to go to Wyll's Act3 moments;- Florrick Confrontation;

50.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick appears with a cadre of allies from the upper city - patriars and their guards.

29.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
29.text: The Blade of Frontiers - all pomp and empty oaths. The Sword Coast's most dashing fraud.
29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick spits on the ground in front of Wyll before addressing him. He is taken aback.NodeContext: Please include Florricking Spitting (motion and sound) before delivering the line.

72.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
72.text: I trusted you. I believed in you.
72.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick and her allies ready for battle.

28.speaker: Wyll
28.text: Florrick, what are you on about - what is this?
28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick and her allies ready for battle.

55.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
55.text: Lady Mizora told me everything. How you slaughtered your own father, how you crave his power.
55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick and her allies ready for battle.

7.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
7.text: I thought you were going to save him, but you abused his current state to get rid of him!
7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick and her allies ready for battle.

49.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
49.text: You mean to make the city bow to you and you alone!
49.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick and her allies ready for battle.

31.speaker: Wyll
31.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick and her allies ready for battle.

79.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
79.text: Save it. My duty is to Baldur's Gate - and it holds no place for Ravengard's treacherous spawn.
79.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick and her allies ready for battle.

51.text: Zariel's stunt destroyed countless lives. Mizora is her minion - you can't trust her.
51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: Zariel's stunt destroyed countless lives. Mizora is her minion - you can't trust her.
22.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: The Blade has saved countless lives. He is still the man you thought he was.
0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

32.speaker: Wyll
32.text: Florrick. I am my father's son. You know me. Will you really trust the word of a devil over mine?
32.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

42.speaker: Wyll
42.text: I swear I did everything I could to save him. I swear it by all I hold dear.
42.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

3.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Florrick pauses, then orders her companions to stand down.

91.text: By the living gods, I believe you.

73.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
73.text: By the living gods, I believe you.

9.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
9.text: What darkness has fallen upon us.

8.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
8.text: Wyll, there's something you must know. I should've told you sooner, but I'd hoped somehow your father would return to us.

71.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
71.text: He knew about the Absolute. I thought little of it at first - but he realised the danger before anyone else did.

69.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
69.text: He understood that if the cult were successful in raising an army, Baldur's Gate would be doomed.

62.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
62.text: Before the Absolutists abducted him, he told me that should he fall, I must seek you out and give you this message.

5.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
5.text: Your father trained you in the ways of the great champions. You are to use those lessons to wake the wyrm under the city. He is oathbound to answer your call and come to our aid.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: A wyrm? Are you saying there's a dragon living under the city?

75.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
75.text: A bronze dragon, yes. He sleeps beneath us even now, awaiting a hero to rouse him.

61.speaker: Wyll
61.text: Courage. Insight. Strategy. Justice. I remember them well. Father made me recite them every morning.

19.speaker: Wyll
19.text: I would like to know more about this wyrm.

36.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
36.text: The wyrm goes by many names. Ansur. The Waiting Storm. The Heart of the Gate.

30.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
30.text: He promised Balduran he'd protect the city if ever its existence was threatened. But just the once.

87.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
87.text: Since then the city faced countless threats - but the Baldurians overcame them all. There was never any need to call upon the wyrm. But this time, things are different.

60.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
60.text: This is the greatest threat Baldur's Gate ever faced. Your father was right - we need Ansur's help. With him gone, the wyrm's awakening now falls to you.

83.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
83.text: The duke gave me this - 'The Legend of Ansur'. An ancient epic, ill-remembered, dismissed as a mere tale.

80.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
80.text: Let it set the path before you.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: The dragon Ansur is dead, Florrick.

13.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
13.text: We need to prepare for battle. I will head out and seek out more allies to help our cause.

20.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
20.text: The fate of the city now rests with us.

70.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
70.text: May your father's courage be with you, Wyll. And may we drive the Absolute forever from the Coast.

17.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
17.text: Dead. So once more, fortune turns against us.

27.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
27.text: We need to prepare for battle. I will head out and seek out more allies to help our cause.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: Your faith in Wyll is well-founded. We will seek the wyrm and ask for his help.

74.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
74.text: Thank you. In darkness, I see your light.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: You're going to trust him? You do know he made a pact with a devil, right?

1.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
1.text: Ravengard blood runs through Wyll's veins. I choose to trust. I hope you choose to honour it.

10.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
10.text: I will go and assemble any allies I can find. When the battle horns call, we'll stand ready.

38.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
38.text: Unleash the wyrm, Wyll - let his tempest swallow the Absolute and its allies. Good luck!

35.speaker: Player
35.text: Wyll? What do you make of this?

6.speaker: Wyll
6.text: Baldur's Gate stands on the brink of the abyss. Let's awaken the wyrm, and take back the city.

66.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
66.text: Ravengard's blood courses through your veins. Your father would be proud.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Please. You're staking the city's future on a fairy tale.

33.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
33.text: A history told by Balduran himself, stretching a thousand years back. It is no fable - it is plain truth.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: Let the dragon sleep. We'll deal with the Absolute on our own terms.

45.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
45.text: Even Baldur's Gate's greatest warrior knew when to contain the storm and when to release it.

23.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
23.text: That warrior was your father, Wyll. If you prize his ways, you'll seek out the wyrm.

4.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
4.text: There is a tome - 'The Legend of Ansur'. An ancient epic, ill-remembered, dismissed as a mere tale.

11.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
11.text: Your father gave it to me, but it was stolen. Find it, let it set the path before you.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: Waking a dragon doesn't sound like a good idea.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: Ravengard could still be alive. And we intend to save him.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Ravengard's death was Gortash's doing. There was nothing we could do.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: Mizora lied to you. We tried to save Ravengard, and she sabotaged us.

88.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
88.text: It's true, Florrick. You can't believe her. She's a devil. Will you really trust her word over mine?

46.speaker: Wyll
46.text: It's true, Florrick. You can't believe her. She's a devil. Will you really trust her word over mine?

26.text: How easily the lies fall from your tongue.

53.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
53.text: How easily the lies fall from your tongue.

59.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
59.text: Your fate is set. You will pay the price of Ulder Ravengard's death!

67.speaker: Player
67.text: A relevant thread of knowledge pokes at your mind. Explore it.

84.speaker: Narrator
84.text: *You remember the stories of Elturel's fall. The city was dragged into the Hells at Zariel's behest - and Ravengard along with it.*

81.speaker: Narrator
81.text: *You remember the stories of Elturel's fall. The city was dragged into the Hells at Zariel's behest - and Ravengard along with it.*

78.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
78.text: The Blade of Frontiers, hero of the Sword Coast - and his own father's killer. I can barely believe it.

18.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
18.text: The Blade of Frontiers, hero of the Sword Coast - and his own father's killer. I can barely believe it.

56.text: My thoughts are not for you to know. To arms, champions!

77.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
77.text: My thoughts are not for you to know. To arms, champions!

63.speaker: Player
63.text: When we found you in prison, you'd given up. Who's the hypocrite here?

44.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
44.text: Yet I came through, I did what was right. You butchered Ulder like the devils you are.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Attack us, then. Let's see who's left standing.

52.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
52.text: Then your fate is set. You will pay the price of Ulder Ravengard's death!
